title: Martin Bashir on heartbreaking death that made him do Celebrity X Factor
text:

Martin Bashir was driven to go on X Factor Celebrity because his brother’s death has made him take risks.

TV interviewer Martin lost his beloved sibling Tommy at 29 after a lifelong struggle against muscle disease.

And he has revealed that he still hears Tommy’s voice whenever he is faced with any daunting situation.

Speaking on the opening show about his reasons for taking part, he says: “Every time I have faced a challenge I have heard him whispering saying, ‘What excuse do you have? You have no excuse.

“‘You have never sung but someone has come to you and said, ‘Give it a shot’. And that is my motivation’.”

(Image: PA)

Tommy was born with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, a condition which causes the body to deteriorate over time and is 100% fatal.

He died in 1991, having been cared for by Martin and his mum for much of his life.

Martin, one of five children, says in the show: “When you grow up with a child and you fight over toys at four and he never fights back and then, by the time he is 13 he can’t feed himself, you feel that you have no excuse for turning down opportunities.”

Martin adds that he is “emotionally bowled over” as he explains why he is competing to the judges. And Simon Cowell says: “It is always about the person and the story and we related to your story.”

(Image: Martin Bashir)

Speaking to the Mirror, Martin said: “That’s my motivation. It is a very personal thing.

“I am 57 in January. In many ways people would say, ‘What the hell are you doing it for?’ and that is the reason.

“My mum is still alive and she is 80 and the loss to her was enormous, but she also knows I was the main carer to my brother as a child. He was the most significant influence on me. More than my parents.”

(Image: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

On a lighter note ahead of the show, Martin admitted: “I probably sound something like a constipated donkey but I am going to give it my best shot.”

Others competing include a band made up of Love Island stars, Baywatch star David Hasselhoff’s daughter Hayley and Jenny “The Vixen” Ryan from quiz show The Chase.

*X Factor Celebrity starts on ITV tomorrow at 8.35pm.
